Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2010 07:38PM Heatherlynn wrote: So, should I have cause for concern?
Posts.Title: Significant Growth of pre-existing lesion Heatherlynn Heatherlynn

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2010 11:19AM Heatherlynn wrote: Good Morning Beesie :) First I want to thank you so very much for the information and the boost in my confidence.  Now I will continue with the saga.  Yes, I did have a mammogram prior to the ultrasound and this was ordered as there was a palpable lump in the breast.  All I was told was that the mammogram suggested an ultrasound with a biopsy.  The ultrasound was done and again, the biopsy was ordered.  I've already elaborated on the sequence of events following this.  As for the surgeon's remarks when I told her the radiologist refused to do the biopsy, she stated that she would have the Chief Radiologist perform the biopsy but never followed through.  I repeatedly called the surgeon's office and my calls were never returned.  The surgeon does not have an assistant so my only alternative was to consult my family physician which I did and she immediately ordered another ultrasound.  The last ultrasound showed significant growth of the lesion/mass of which I was informed by my family physician last Tuesday.  She has referred me to a different surgeon and I should hear when my appt. with him will be within the next 4-5 days.  After my consultation with him, the biopsy will be scheduled.  Unfortunately I do not have copies of my mammo or u/s reports.  What a merry-go-round this has been.  I will ask for copies of my ultrasound reports though and post the results.  There is a 2nd mass in the left breast measuring 0.9 cm and I am assuming that it has not changed since the last u/s unless they are going to biopsy that too and I'll have to remember to ask the surgeon when I meet him.  I know they are very concerned about the mass in the right breast and hope they schedule everything quickly.  This is a small town but there is no excuse for the lack of follow up on the part of my former surgeon nor the actions of the radiologist that refused to do my initial biopsy.  I am keeping positive thoughts although my initial fear has been replaced with anger at the medical professionals and their lack of action.  All this promoted me to research as much as possible and fortunately, I found this wonderful forum.  Again, my sincere thanks and I will re-post as soon as I get more news.  In the interim, are there any questions I should be asking the surgeon?  My mind is in overdrive now lol.
Posts.Title: Significant Growth of pre-existing lesion Heatherlynn Heatherlynn

Posts.Content: Heatherlynn wrote: Hello everyone.  Last November, a lesion/mass measuring 2.5 cm was found in my right breast at the 9 o'clock position.  I was scheduled for a biopsy the following March and the radiologist said "I am NOT doing this biopsy unless you insist.".  I left immediately as I was not about to let this woman touch me.  Unfortunately the surgeon did not follow up.  My family physician did a follow up ultrasound last month and the ultrasound now shows "significant growth" in the 8 and 9 o'clock positions of the same breast.  I am waiting to see a new surgeon and have been informed by my family doctor that there is no doubt a biopsy will be done.  Should I be concerned?  I had cervical cancer 30 years ago and there is cancer is my family (we are all fine) although there is no breast cancer in our family.  Any suggestions or questions that I should be asking the surgeon before they proceed with the biopsy?  I need as much information as I can get as I have been told that this is not a good sign. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Significant Growth of pre-existing lesion Heatherlynn Heatherlynn

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2010 08:40AM Heatherlynn wrote: Good Morning Beesie, The consultation with the surgeon is scheduled for Nov. 17th however, I am at the top of the list should there be a cancellation.  Thank you for the suggested questions to ask the surgeon and I hope I don't forget any of them. lol.  Will keep you posted and again, my heartfelt thanks. Sincerely, Heather
Posts.Title: Significant Growth of pre-existing lesion Heatherlynn Heatherlynn

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2010 03:57PM Heatherlynn wrote: Thank you Beesie.  Now to calm down my husband lol. Sincerely, Heather
Posts.Title: Significant Growth of pre-existing lesion Heatherlynn Heatherlynn

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2010 10:53PM Heatherlynn wrote: Good evening Beesie, I met with the new surgeon yesterday and my biopsy is scheduled for Nov. 30th and will receive my results on Dec. 8th.  The surgeon was fantastic and answered every question I had very thoroughly and maintained eye contact throughout our conversation.  In other words, he wasn't writing notes while I was asking questions.  After routine questions re family history and my health history, he did a visual examination and the right breast is mildly distorted.  "Hands on" examination revealed a palpable mass in the 8-9 o'clock position.  The ultrasound report did not indicate how much the mass has grown other than it is significant.  Ironically, the radiologist that wrote the most recent u/s results was the radiologist that refused to do the biopsy in March.  The surgeon PROMISED me that the previous radiologist that refused to do the first biopsy will not be performing the procedure.  They are going straight to biopsy without mammo rounds prior to biopsy as this should have been done last March.  There wasn't any mention of bi-rads in my u/s.  The surgeon would not give an opinion as to what he thought it may be, just that there is cause for concern.  Again, I am remaining positive and was fully informed as to the procedure and what to expect afterwards (bruising and swelling) and I'll use ice packs, should the need arise.  I will keep you posted.  Again, my sincere thanks for the confidence you have instilled me. Sincerely, Heatherlynn
Posts.Title: Significant Growth of pre-existing lesion Heatherlynn Heatherlynn

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2010 03:21PM - edited Oct 22, 2010 03:51PM by Heatherlynn Hi Denna, The biopsies are performed here in Ontario by radiologists.  The radiologist that read my first ultrasound found it to be suspicious and recommended a biopsy.  Based on this, I was referred to a surgeon to whom the biopsy report would be sent.  The radiologist that refused to do the biopsy felt that the lesion was only "blocked ducts" caused by breastfeeding and that it was a waste of HER time.  She flatly refused to follow the recommendations of the previous radiologist and surgeon.  She did NOT know that I have never even given birth !  So she made an assumption without knowing anything about me.  I am 58 years old and she could have at least asked about my history.  I explained this chain of events to my former surgeon and she NEVER FOLLOWED UP.  What a mess !  That is when my family physician stepped in, repeated the ultrasound, got the results showing significant growth, and now I am waiting to meet with a new surgeon.  The purpose of seeing the new surgeon is to basically start from scratch.  Our healthcare system in Ontario leaves a lot to be be desired so I am hoping that this new surgeon will be on top of his game and that the biopsy will done in a timely fashion.  My situation is complicated by only by lack of follow up by my former surgeon.  So here I sit with a lesion/mass that is growing significantly and now I am starting to get concerned.  It is my understanding that benign growths do not grown rapidly.  There was no mention of bi-rad rating said to me so I'm the dark as far as that is concerned.  I hope this explains the situation further.  Oh, I forgot to mention that the first surgeon I was sent to also felt that a biopsy was necessary.  The delay between November and March was caused by the former surgeon constantly cancelling my appointments and re-scheduling.  I guess I should informed my family physician sooner.
Posts.Title: Significant Growth of pre-existing lesion Heatherlynn Heatherlynn
